Jersey City, NJ 07302 | 661.577.7042 | casey.r.dean1990@gmail.com | linkedin.com/in/caseyrdean
## Overview

Growth and learning focused military veteran with passion for AWS cloud architecture, IaC, and secure solution delivery. Background in software implementation, innovation consulting, and entrepreneurship, with a focus on designing scalable, cost-effective systems using cloud services. Experienced in leading cross-functional teams through full solution lifecycles, from strategy to deployment. Passionate about using AI/ML, serverless technologies, RAG, GenAI and to modernize systems, enhance performance, and drive measurable value.
## Skills & Technologies

EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, VPC, CloudFront, Route 53, APIs, IAM, CloudTrail, CloudWatch, Systems Manager, CloudFormation, CDK, Terraform, GitHub, Jenkins, CodePipeline, Cognito, SAML, RBAC, KMS, TLS, FedRAMP, Zero Trust, CAF, DynamoDB, Redshift, Athena, Glue, data modeling, QuickSight, REST, OAuth2, JWT, OpenAPI, Postman, Bedrock, SageMaker, Gradio, Agile, OKRs, Jira, Python, TypeScript, Bash, YAML, JSON, HCL, SQL, JavaScript, React, Next.js, Tailwind, Anthropic MCP, AutoGen, LangGraph, CrewAI, OpenAI SDK, OCR, NLP, GenAI, HuggingFace, Weaviate, Pinecone, OpenAI API, RAG
## EXPERIENCE
### Jaggaer, Jersey City, NJ
**Solutions Consultant – Professional Services**
09/2024 – Present

Led end-to-end solution architecture and implementation for enterprise SaaS AI tools such as AppZen, translating complex business requirements into scalable, secure system designs across discovery, configuration, deployment, and post-go-live transition.

Acted as the primary architectural advisor to client stakeholders, guiding trade-off decisions across functionality, integrations, data models, compliance constraints, and long-term extensibility to ensure sustainable, supportable solutions.

Designed future-state architectures and workflows within Statement of Work (SOW) boundaries, proactively identifying technical and operational risks related to integrations, data integrity, and adoption, and mitigating them prior to production rollout.

Bridged business, engineering, and support teams by documenting architectural decisions, system workflows, and configuration rationale, preserving architectural intent through implementation and enabling smooth operational handoff.
### SOPHEON, Raleigh, NC
**Senior Innovation Management Consultant**
• Drove design and deployment of Portfolio Management solutions across $15M+ ARR in federal contracts by aligning delivery with customer goals and managing scope from concept to execution.
• Delivered 12 sensitive DoD solutions by guiding secure, compliance-focused technical decisions and aligning architectures with mission goals and FedRAMP standards.
• Worked backwards from stakeholders needs to align SaaS platform capabilities with expected outcomes, reducing delivery time by 18% and improving overall project efficiency.
• Led complex migrations of SaaS platform implementations and deployments, ensuring seamless transitions and performance-optimized configurations across enterprise environments.
### Wilde Group, Raleigh, NC
**Research Analyst / Innovation Analyst / Founder**

• Coordinated cross-functional teams across product, engineering, and business groups for 4 Fortune 500 clients, using research and design thinking workshops to define 0–1 solution opportunities that shaped early architecture direction.

• Guided early architecture exploration by translating research findings into prioritized technical focus areas, contributing to the launch of 9 enterprise innovation initiatives and improving cross-team alignment during 0–N development planning.

• Partnered with engineering leads to evaluate system constraints and technology gaps, producing modernization recommendations that reduced integration blockers by 25% across 3 business units and helped teams converge on feasible architecture options.

• Provided data-informed inputs to R&D-style planning efforts, strengthening C-suite clarity on technology priorities and cutting early-stage architectural alignment cycles by 30% during initiative planning.
### STRYKER, Kalamazoo, MI
**Lead Analyst Global Talent Acquisition Insights**
• Unified cross-departmental data models in Workday to establish a centralized KPI framework, increasing executive visibility into talent benchmarks and streamlining reporting workflows by 35%.
• Developed a Tableau-based reporting system to restore talent lifecycle visibility post-Workday migration, eliminating 40+ manual reports and reducing stakeholder reporting requests by 50%.

• Created LMS training and led enablement sessions for 500+ global recruiters and talent leaders, teaching them how to use data to improve talent targeting strategies within their unique regional markets.

• Redesigned recruiting workflows by analyzing hiring pain points and bottlenecks, reducing time-to-fill by 15%, cutting agency use by 6%, lowering offer timelines below 30 days, and increasing offer acceptance by 22%.
### ELEGANT SOLUTIONS, Houston, TX
**Founding Partner**

• Worked backward to deconstruct ER inefficiencies, poor communication, lack of transparency, and low HCAHPS survey participation by patients to deliver solutions that improved patient transparency of process and boosted federal survey engagement.

• Led discovery sessions with over 200 emergency room patients and hospital staff including executives across multiple HCA regions to uncover workflow inefficiencies, communication breakdowns, and gaps in patient experience.

• Conceived and wireframed an ER platform MVP, turning frontline insights into a patient-focused design that clarified visit timelines; oversaw development of a custom IoT-based mesh network independent of HL7, implemented timebound KPIs that increased ER throughput by 5%, and improved hospital survey participation by 65% during proof-of-concept testing.

• Designed an automated reporting feature tied to patient interactions, enabling a first-of-its-kind customer recovery tool for ERs that strengthened stakeholder visibility and grant-readiness; contributed to platform success leading to company sale in 2019.
## Education
Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA): Entrepreneurship
University of WI - Whitewater
## Certifications
AWS Solution Architect – Associate SSA-C03
